meanings.definition: A machine that dispenses cash when a personal identification number is entered.
meanings.sent1: I went to the cashpoint to withdraw money for groceries.
meanings.sent2: She quickly found a nearby cashpoint to get some cash for the concert tickets.
meanings.sent3: The cashpoint seemed to have a sense of humor, giving out extra money by mistake.
meanings.sent4: The cashpoint was like a magical box, turning my numbers into real cash.
meanings.sent5: The neon sign above the cashpoint glowed invitingly, promising instant money.

meanings.definition: The act of withdrawing money from a cashpoint.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, I needed a quick cashpoint visit to get some cash.
meanings.sent2: His wallet was empty, so he resorted to the cashpoint for some emergency funds.
meanings.sent3: The cashpoint line was so long that it felt like a race to get to the front.
meanings.sent4: She saw the cashpoint as a helpful friend, always there when she needed money.
meanings.sent5: The sound of cash being dispensed from the cashpoint was music to his ears.
